page.title: 11The Old Vicarage, Stoulton
page.content: The Old Vicarage in Stoulton was built in Tudor times and was extended in 1820. An impressive archway spans the large house and garage which was once the stables and coach house. The house was where the vicar of the Norman Church opposite lived many years ago. Now the renovated church is served by one vicar who cares for two other local parishes, Pirton and Drakes Broughton where he is based. To the left of the large, colourful grounds are acres of corn and wheat fields. Previously they had been fruit orchards which were cleared seventeen years ago. In one of these fields lies the decaying ruins of an old mortuary. An interesting village where, sadly, employment and amenities have declined because most villagers have cars and commute to Worcester.
